article.headline: Weber St. 84, Montana St. 63
article.story: OGDEN, Utah (AP) -- David Patten scored a game-high 25 points and Weber State defeated Montana State 84-63 Saturday. Patten scored the final eight points of the first half for the Wildcats (10-7 overall, 3-1 Big Sky), who led 40-33 at halftime. Patten also made all 10 of his free-throw attempts in the half. Nick Dissly led the Bobcats (4-12, 1-2) with 21 points while Carlos Taylor had 12. A pair of free throws from Adrian Zamora pulled Montana State within 63-57, its closest deficit during the second half, with 8:31 remaining. However, the Bobcats scored just three points in the final five minutes as Weber State pulled away. Dan Henry scored a career-high 21 points, while Juan Tyler Billings had 12 and Juan Pablo Silveira added 11 for Weber State. Patten also grabbed nine rebounds as the Wildcats outrebounded the Bobcats 40-32.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
